definitions.definition: utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, a feeling or intention, or an instruction.
synonyms: vocalize More"she felt her stomach flutter as he said her name"declare
rejoin; informalcome out with "“I must go
suggest "I can't conjure up the words to say how I feel"

definitions.definition: (of a text or a symbolic representation) convey specified information or instructions.
examples: the law says such behavior is an offense

definitions.definition: enable a listener or reader to learn or understand something by conveying or revealing (information or ideas).
examples: I don't want to say too much

definitions.definition: (of a clock or watch) indicate (a specified time).
examples: the clock says ten past two

definitions.definition: be asserted or reported (often used to avoid committing the speaker or writer to the truth of the assertion).
examples: they were said to be training freedom fighters

definitions.definition: present a consideration in favor of or excusing (someone or something).
examples: all I can say for him is that he's a better writer than some

definitions.definition: utter the whole of (a speech or other set of words, typically one learned in advance).
examples: we say the Pledge of Allegiance each morning
synonyms: orate "they sang hymns and said a prayer"

definitions.definition: assume something in order to work out what its consequences would be; make a hypothesis.
examples: let's say we pay five thousand dollars in the first year
synonyms: posit "let's say you'd just won a million dollars"

definitions.definition: used parenthetically to indicate that something is being suggested as possible or likely but not certain.
examples: the form might include, say, a dozen questions

definitions.definition: used to express surprise or to draw attention to a remark or question.
examples: say, did you notice any blood?

definitions.definition: an opportunity for stating one's opinion or feelings.
examples: the voters are entitled to have their say on the treaty
synonyms: two cents' worth "everyone is entitled to their say"

definitions.definition: an opportunity to influence developments and policy.
examples: the assessor will have a say in how the money is spent
synonyms: part "don't I have any say in the matter?"
